description.narrative: Program quality educator for all in Mali is the result of a partnership between Oxfam novib, international education EI, the Ministry of Education of Mali national and civil society organizations: National Union of Education and Culture SNEC and the Association of youth for the endogenous development in the Sahel AJDES Children receiving quality education will have better opportunities to decent jobs and will participate actively in their society. Mali is ranked one of the lowest quality education systems in the world. Despite significant progress in terms of access toprimary education, 800.000 children are not in school. Children completing the school cycle do so without acquiring the basic reading, or the specialized skills to enter the workforce or continue their education. Thepoor learning outcomes are mainly a result of the shortage of professionally trained teachers with relevant skills, knowledge and competences. Oxfam and Education International with the help of Comic Relief have joined forces to improve the quality of the education system. Building on lessons learned from an earlier project that focused on the professional competences and acceptance in publicsystem of primary community school teachers, this project will focus on improving student learning at lower secondary education. Factors to improve the education received include: Quality teachers with improved teaching skills and knowledge, particularly on girlseducation and technical and life skills; Consensus-based teacher competence profile that informs teacher training and further professional development; Teachers that receive quality pre- and in-service training through improved training modules. The project will take the mobile telephone development as an opportunity to innovate in-service teacher training and will develop some modules to be usedon SD cards. Development of new modules for teacher training and where possible digital modules by the government in partnershipwith teacher training institutes, civil society and teachers;Being in the public system will also give informal teachers access to in-service training and improved salary. The role of Mali Teacher Union SNEC member is to push advocacy for the integration of the community teachers in the public sector for unqualified teachers .It is one of the main partners and has been very involved in training, and advocacy; Very involved in the identification of the ECOM teachers; Strong mobilisation of its members. The teacher Union will appreciate the quality of the Organization of the sessions of training of teachers at the level of the different CAP of the Ségou AE. Collect the comments and recommendations of the various partners (directors, teachers). Make the necessary adjustments to the needs for effective future training activities and follow-up implementation.The SNEC is the partner of international of Educationin Mali. This project a part of Program quality educator for all in Mali and Ouganda , the result of a partnership between Oxfam novib, international education EI, the Ministry of Education national and civil society organizations. In Mali the National Teacher Union SNEC and the Association of youth for the endogenous development in the Sahel AJDES are the lead of project . The project will improve quality of education beacause Children receiving quality education will have better opportunities to decent jobs and will participate actively in their society. Oxfam and Education International with the help of Comic Relief have joined forces to improve thequality of the education system since 2012 in Mali.

participating-org.narrative:
It is created in the Republic of Mali the National Union opened to all workers of National education, Youth, Sports, Arts, Culture and handicraft departments (Public and Private Sector) named" National Union of Education and Culture ". Acronym: S.N.E.C. TEL: 20 22 61 46/fax : 20 23 00 25 Site: www.csfef.snec.org / Email : s.snec@yahoo.fr
SNEC cooperates with retired workers of education, Youth, Sports, Culture, and of the handicraft departments. Its Moto is UNITY # SOLIDARITY # ACTION
SNEC is a member of the NationalUnion of Mali Workers, UNTM. De facto all SNEC militants are also militants of UNTM and must respect sts statutes and internal regulations
SNEC headquarters are in Bamako but can be transferred in any other location in the Republic Mali upon decision of the congress.
SNEC is independent from all political parties but the Union can support any political action aiming to improve living and working conditions workers.
The goals of the National Education and Culture Union are: Defend moral and material interests of militants Defend freedoms of union and reinforce individual and collectives freedoms; Make propositions to the government supporting the protection Malian school, the development of instruction, the education and promotion of the youth, sports, arts, culture and handicraft, Look after the spirit of cooperation and solidarity between its members while sustaining the cooperative and mutual activities by the creation and / or the backing of the cooperative and mutual
Rights and duties of Militants. Any member is a voter and eligible within the school of the school cluster, or of the service where s/he works. S/He has besides the right to pretend to exercise union responsibilities at all levels, and to resort to the processes and competent organs to defend him/her self in case of sanctions
Structures and Organization The structures of SNEC are:
In the Regions : The committee of enterprise is the subdivision at the level the communes, the division at the level of the circles and the regional committee of coordination at the level of the regions
Thedecision making bodies of SNEC are: - The general Assembly; - The Conference of subdivision and of sub section - The Conference of de division and of section - The regional Coordination Conference - The National Council and the Congress SNEC organs are : - TheExecutive Bureau of the Enterprise Comity - The Executive Bureau of the Subdivision or of the sub section - The Executive Bureau of the Division ou de la section - The Executive Bureau of the Regional Coordination Comity - The National Executive Bureau and - La control Commission.
Resources SNEC resources are built by: - Contributions - sales of the newspaper" THE EDUCATOR ", - Returns from feasts and various demonstrations, - Subsidies and subscriptions, - Grants and bequests.
Of Information technologies and communication SNEC publishes a newspaper "THE EDUCATOR" and enliven its Web site. The National Executive bureau, inthe name of the NationalCouncil insures its administration, Publication and management.
Syndicat National de l'Education & la Culture
